resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Check API compatibility with AWS Java SDK

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The S3 API spec says the default US region should be returned to the client as an empty element. I believe this has changed since initial S3 version:

{panel}
Name	 Description
LocationConstraint	
Specifies the Region where the bucket resides. For more information about region endpoints and location constraints, go to Regions and Endpoints in the Amazon Web Services Glossary.

Type: String

Valid Values: EU | eu-west-1 | us-west-1 | us-west-2 | ap-southeast-1 | ap-southeast-2 | ap-northeast-1 | sa-east-1 | empty string (for the US Classic Region)

Ancestry: None
When the bucket's Region is US Classic, Amazon S3 returns an empty string for the bucket's Region:

<LocationConstraint xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/"/>
{panel}

Walrus returns "US" by default if no location constraint is given during bucket creation. This is no longer a valid response value for S3. Line 487 in WalrusManager.java explicitly sets "US", this should be changed to an empty string or null.

This may cause S3 clients to fail if they are looking for one of a set of region endpoints specific for s3.
fields.summary: Walrus BucketLocation constraint should be empty for default location

    973             xml.sax.parseString(body, h)
--> 974             return rs.LocationConstraint
    975         else:
    976             raise self.connection.provider.storage_response_error(

AttributeError: 'ResultSet' object has no attribute 'LocationConstraint'
{noformat}

Hi [~zhill],

I have tested by changing the mapping name,

{noformat}
diff --git a/clc/modules/object-storage-common/src/main/resources/s3-2006-03-01-binding.xml b/clc/modules/object-storage-common/src/main/resources/s3-2006-03-01-binding.xml
index 43ca2d7..07464b7 100644
--- a/clc/modules/object-storage-common/src/main/resources/s3-2006-03-01-binding.xml
+++ b/clc/modules/object-storage-common/src/main/resources/s3-2006-03-01-binding.xml
@@ -509,7 +509,7 @@
                <structure map-as="com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.msgs.WalrusRequestType" usage="optional" />
        </mapping>

-       <mapping name="GetBucketLocationResponse" class="com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.msgs.GetBucketLocationResponseType">
+       <mapping name="LocationConstraint" class="com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.msgs.GetBucketLocationResponseType">
                <value name="LocationConstraint" field="locationConstraint" usage="optional" />
        </mapping>
{noformat}

It works fine with these changes when there is no region set. But SDKs which force to have a region name (e.g aws java sdk), kind of breaks the output.

{{LocationContraint}} without region,
{noformat}
<LocationConstraint xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>
{noformat}

{{LocationContraint}} with region,
{noformat}
<LocationConstraint xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <LocationConstraint>eucalyptus</LocationConstraint>
</LocationConstraint>
{noformat}

Where it should be,
{noformat}
<LocationConstraint xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">eucalyptus</LocationConstraint>
{noformat}
[~wwannemacher], yep, that looks correct. Today is code freeze for 3.4.1, so if you can get it in today go for it. We need to verify with both Boto and AWS SDK.
[~wwannemacher], please go ahead. This mapping works fine.

Fixed.
{noformat}
